alert.note: Alert for Greater Lake Tahoe Area (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 28 at 11:40AM PST until January 01 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY EVENING THROUGH LATE SATURDAY NIGHT ABOVE 7000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible above 7000 feet. Storm total snow accumulations of 1 to 3 feet above 7000 feet, except up to 5 feet above 8000 feet. Winds gusting to 45 mph, except 100+ mph along the ridges. Wave heights of 2 to 4 feet on Lake Tahoe. * WHERE...Greater Lake Tahoe Area. * WHEN...From Thursday evening through late Saturday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree damage. Strong winds and high waves may capsize small vessels. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow totals of 1 to 5 inches below 6500 feet (including Lake Tahoe) will be possible, mainly Saturday night into early Sunday as snow levels drop.
info.instruction: Now is the time to prepare an emergency kit for your home and car. If traveling consider alternate plans, remember to carry tire chains, extra food, water and clothing. Once the storm arrives, travel may be difficult or impossible for an extended period of time. Avoid boating on Lake Tahoe until conditions improve.
